message_1: Identify the major product and write the reaction mechanism for the bromination of toluene in the presence of iron (III) bromide as a catalyst.
message_2:
The major product of the bromination of toluene in the presence of iron (III) bromide as a catalyst is ortho-bromotoluene and para-bromotoluene, with para-bromotoluene being the major product due to steric hindrance.

Reaction mechanism:

1. Formation of the electrophile:
FeBr3 + Br2 → Br+ + FeBr4-

2. Electrophilic aromatic substitution:
Toluene reacts with the electrophile (Br+) at the ortho and para positions due to the electron-donating effect of the methyl group, forming a resonance-stabilized carbocation.

3. Deprotonation:
The carbocation loses a proton to the FeBr4- ion, regenerating the FeBr3 catalyst and forming the final products, ortho-bromotoluene and para-bromotoluene.

Overall reaction:
Toluene + Br2 + FeBr3 → ortho-bromotoluene + para-bromotoluene + HBr + FeBr3
